text:
Raskolnikov sat, terror gripping him. 

“What do you want?” he asked, voice trembling. 

The man bowed low, touching the ground. 

“What is it?” Raskolnikov cried. 

“I have sinned,” the man whispered. 

“How?” 

“By evil thoughts.” 

They locked eyes. 

“I was vexed,” the man continued. “You asked the porters about the blood.”

Raskolnikov's mind raced. 

“Who came?” he interrupted. 

“I did. I’ve wronged you.” 

“From that house?” 

“I stood at the gate… remember?” 

Memories flooded back. 

Voices urging him to the police station. 

Raskolnikov felt the weight of his past.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov encounters a man who admits to feeling guilty for having evil thoughts about him.
